content: Design for sidenav
Hey guys, it would be very helpful if you guys can give your reviews about the new sidenav design I made. Please react with a :thumbs_up: if you like it.

Looks good! Are we sure about the colour scheme though? Some users may find the two greens to be too similar.
(I'm not an experienced designer, though, this is just off the top of my head).
yeah, I think we'll want white for the hover/click (or whatever we currently use in the non-mobile view)?

for context this is what it looks like in non-mobile view
pasted image
@Rishi Gupta @Kanishk Kakar Thanks for the suggestions. I changed the design. How does it look now? pasted image
Much better, thanks for working on this!
@Nikhil Vats I think some of the options are now hard to read, because the headings we expect to display on the bluer/darker part of the gradient. I think you need to make the background darker.
I don't see enough of a contrast between the gray text and the green background

Still think this holds true even with the new gradient.
@Cynthia Lin I tried making the background color contrasting but if we want to keep the background of sidenav same as that of topnav area, I don't think there can be enough contrast. See this
@Rishi Gupta @Tim Abbott What are your opinions on the contrast? Which one should be finalised the first one or the second one?
I don't think the background needs to be changed, it's perfectly fine. The text color can be improved though
Specifically, I don't understand why the currently selected text (with > on the left) needs to be a different color than the unselected tab text
Since > already indicates which tab is selected, can't we just make all the text the same white color instead of the off gray color that you currently use for unselected text?
@Cynthia Lin Let's hear others' opinion and go with what all of us agree to.

Specifically, I don't understand why the currently selected text (with > on the left) needs to be a different color than the unselected tab text

If we change this behaviour in sidenav, we have to change this in topnav too, I suppose, so let's see.

I agree with Cynthia that the text colors in your sidebar seem slightly different from the text color of the top navbar on zulipchat.com. It could be an illusion due to the screenshotting process or something else though.
Are you using the same text color and opacity for the sidebar as we do in the current top nav bar?
Yes, exactly the same. White color with opacity 0.7 for inactive and 1 for active links, might be an illusion due to screenshotting.

@Rishi Gupta I have a doubt, as of now we are using black and white logo of Zulip in sidenav but as you can see in the design, I propose to use the green and white logo. The problem is the black and white logo was served at a static url but the green and white one is not. And the code for logo in sidenav is like this -

.portico-header .content>ul:before {
    content: "Zulip";
    display: block;
    margin-top: 20px;
    padding-top: 5px;
    margin-left: 10px;
    width: 100px;
    height: 40px;
    font-size: 1.5rem;
    text-align: right;
    color: #454545;
    background-size: 40px auto;
    background-image: url(/static/images/zulip-logo.svg);
    background-repeat: no-repeat;
}

The code for green and white logo is like this - 

<svg class="brand-logo" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="100%" height="100%" viewBox="0 0 40 40" version="1.1">
       <g transform="translate(-297.14285,-466.64792)">
                    <circle cx="317.14285" cy="486.64792" r="19.030317" style="fill:#fff;stroke-width:1.93936479;stroke:transparent"></circle>
                    <path d="m309.24286 477.14791 14.2 0 1.6 3.9-11.2 11.9 9.6 0 1.6 3.2-14.2 0-1.6-3.9 11.2-11.9-9.6 0z"
                     style="fill:#52c2af;stroke:#52c2af"></path>
       </g>
</svg>

What should I do?
We can serve the green and white logo on a static url by exporting the code in a svg file. What are your opinions?
my guess is that the logo (in the non-mobile case) is only white, and just has a transparent background?

I don't see enough of a contrast between the gray text and the green background

  • @Cynthia Lin said something I consider very meaningful.
  • Most of photos I have seen here are from young people. What about the eyes of old people that start to get in love with Zulip?
  • When I gave my mobile phone to people insert their e-mail address, instead of me typing it. The majory complained about the Zulip web character size.
  • There is another important detail in this issue
  • I am sure you are all professional and are plenty of UI design knowledge and Zulip team has done lots of research to provide the best Ui for Zulipers. However it seems there is an eternal learning process inside designing world.
@Pedro Barbosa All your points are very considerable, Sir. I would love to discuss them with @Tim Abbott @Rishi Gupta and hopefully consider them while designing the UI.
